doc.description:
DB API


These methods have to be implemented on the database and another class .
Most methods usable on query should be also usable directly through database, which will create the query apply its method.

name: bbn\Db\Api

select.name: select
select.summary: Returns the first row resulting from the query as an object.
select.code: public function select($table, $fields = [], array $where = [], array $order = [], int $start = 0): ?\stdClass;

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: The table's name or a configuration array

doc.description: Returns the first row resulting from the query as an object.

params.name: $table
params.description: The table's name or a configuration array

select.comments:
/**
   * Returns the first row resulting from the query as an object.
	 *
   * @param string|array $table The table's name or a configuration array
   * @param string|array $fields The fields' name
   * @param array $where  The "where" condition
   * @param array|boolean $order The "order" condition
   * @param int $start The "start" condition, default: 0
   * @return null|\stdClass
	 */

selectAll.name: selectAll
selectAll.summary: Fetches a given table and returns an array of text-indexed rows as objects
selectAll.code: public function selectAll($table, $fields = [], array $where = [], array $order = [], int $limit = 0, int $start = 0): ?array;

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: The table's name or a configuration array

doc.description: Fetches a given table and returns an array of text-indexed rows as objects

params.name: $table
params.description: The table's name or a configuration array

selectAll.comments:
/**
	 * Fetches a given table and returns an array of text-indexed rows as objects
	 *
   * @param string|array $table The table's name or a configuration array
   * @param string|array $fields The fields' name
   * @param array $where  The "where" condition
   * @param array | boolean $order The "order" condition, default: false
   * @param int $limit The "limit" condition, default: 0
   * @param int $start The "start" condition, default: 0
   * @return null|array
	 */

selectOne.name: selectOne

	 * @return mixed
	 */

selectAllByKeys.name: selectAllByKeys
selectAllByKeys.summary: Return an array indexed on the first field of the request.
selectAllByKeys.description:
The value will be an array if the request has more than two fields.
Return the same value as "get_key_val".

description_parts.content:
The value will be an array if the request has more than two fields.
Return the same value as "get_key_val".

selectAllByKeys.code: public function selectAllByKeys($table, array $fields = [], array $where = [], array $order = [], int $limit = 0, int $start = 0): ?array;

Return an array indexed on the first field of the request.

   * Return an array indexed on the first field of the request.

stat.name: stat

   * Return an array with the count of values corresponding to the where conditions.

   * @param string|array $table The table's name or a configuration array.
   * @param string $column The field's name.
   * @param array $where The "where" condition.
   * @param array $order The "order" condition.
   * @return null|array
   */

dummyComments:
/**
 * DB API
 *
 *
 * These methods have to be implemented on the database and another class .
 * Most methods usable on query should be also usable directly through database, which will create the query apply its method.
 *
 * @author Thomas Nabet <thomas.nabet@gmail.com>
 * @copyright BBN Solutions
 * @since Apr 4, 2011, 23:23:55 +0000
 * @category  Database
 * @license   http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php MIT
 * @version 0.3
 */

/**
   * Returns the first row resulting from the query as an object.
	 *
   * @param string|array $table The table's name or a configuration array
   * @param string|array $fields The fields' name
   * @param array $where  The "where" condition
   * @param array|boolean $order The "order" condition
   * @param int $start The "start" condition, default: 0
   * @return null|\stdClass
	 */

/**
	 * Fetches a given table and returns an array of text-indexed rows as objects
	 *
   * @param string|array $table The table's name or a configuration array
   * @param string|array $fields The fields' name
   * @param array $where  The "where" condition
   * @param array | boolean $order The "order" condition, default: false
   * @param int $limit The "limit" condition, default: 0
   * @param int $start The "start" condition, default: 0
   * @return null|array
	 */

/**
   * Return the first row resulting from the query as a numeric array.
   *
   * @param string|array $table The table's name or a configuration array
   * @param string|array $fields The fields' name
   * @param array $where  The "where" condition
   * @param array | boolean $order The "order" condition, default: false
   * @param int $start The "start" condition, default: 0
   * @return array
   */

/**
   * Return the searched rows as an array of numeric arrays.
   *
   * @param string|array $table The table's name or a configuration array
   * @param string|array $fields The fields's names
   * @param array $where  The "where" condition
   * @param array | boolean The "order" condition, default: false
   * @param int $limit The "limit" condition, default: 0
   * @param int $start The "start" condition, default: 0
   * @return array
   */

/**
	 * Fetches a given table and returns an array of a single row text-indexed
	 *
   * @param string|array $table The table's name or a configuration array
   * @param string|array $fields The fields' names
   * @param array $where  The "where" condition
   * @param array|boolean $order The "order" condition, default: false
   * @param int $start The "start" condition, default: 0
	 * @return false|array
	 */

/**
	 * Fetches a given table and returns an array of an array of text-indexed rows as arrays
	 *
   * @param string|array $table The table's name or a configuration array
   * @param string|array $fields The fields' names
   * @param array $where  The "where" condition
   * @param array | boolean $order condition, default: false
   * @param int $limit The "limit" condition, default: 0
   * @param int $start The "start" condition, default: 0
	 * @return null|array
	 */

/**
	 * Fetches a given array of tables and returns an array of text-indexed rows as objects
	 *
   * @param array $union An array of select configurations
   * @param string|array $fields The fields' names
   * @param array $where  The "where" condition
   * @param array | boolean $order condition, default: false
   * @param int $limit The "limit" condition, default: 0
   * @param int $start The "start" condition, default: 0
	 * @return null|array
	 */

/**
	 * Fetches a given array of tables and returns an array of text-indexed rows as arrays
	 *
   * @param array $union An array of select configurations
   * @param string|array $fields The fields' names
   * @param array $where  The "where" condition
   * @param array | boolean $order condition, default: false
   * @param int $limit The "limit" condition, default: 0
   * @param int $start The "start" condition, default: 0
	 * @return null|array
	 */

/**
	 * Fetches a given array of tables and returns an array of text-indexed rows as arrays
	 *
   * @param array $union An array of select configurations
   * @param string|array $fields The fields' names
   * @param array $where  The "where" condition
   * @param array | boolean $order condition, default: false
   * @param int $limit The "limit" condition, default: 0
   * @param int $start The "start" condition, default: 0
	 * @return null|array
	 */

/**
	 * Fetches a given table and returns an array of a single row text-indexed
	 *
	 * @param string $table The table name.
	 * @param string $field The field's name.
	 * @param array $where  The "where" condition.
	 * @param string|array $order The "order" condition, default: false.
	 * @param int $start The "start" condition, default: 0.
	 * @return mixed
	 */

/**
   * Return the number of records in the table corresponding to the $where condition (non mandatory).
   *
   * @param string|array $table The table's name or a configuration array
   * @param array $where The "where" condition
   * @return null|int
   */

/**
   * Return an array indexed on the first field of the request.
   * The value will be an array if the request has more than two fields.
   * Return the same value as "get_key_val".
   *
   * @param string|array $table The table's name or a configuration array
   * @param array $fields The fields's name
   * @param array $where The "where" condition
   * @param array|boolean $order The "order" condition
   * @param int $limit The $limit condition, default: 0
   * @param int $start The $limit condition, default: 0
   * @return null|array
   */

/**
   * Return an array with the count of values corresponding to the where conditions.
   *
   * @param string|array $table The table's name or a configuration array.
   * @param string $column The field's name.
   * @param array $where The "where" condition.
   * @param array $order The "order" condition.
   * @return null|array
   */

/**
	 * Inserts/Updates rows in the a given table
	 *
	 * @param $table
	 * @param array|null $values
	 * @param bool $ignore
	 * @return int
	 */

/**
	 * Inserts/Updates rows in the a given table
	 *
	 * @return int
	 */

/**
	 * Updates rows in the a given table
	 *
	 * @param array|string $table
	 * @param array|null $values
	 * @param array|null $where
	 * @param bool $ignore
	 * @return int
	 */

/**
	 * Updates rows in the a given table
	 *
	 * @param array|string $table
	 * @param array|null $values
	 * @param array|null $where
	 * @return int
	 */

/**
   * Deletes rows in the a given table
   *
   * @return int
   */

/**
   * Deletes rows in the a given table
   *
   * @return int
   */

/**
	 * Inserts ignore rows in the a given table
		*
	 * @return int
	 */

/**
	 * Fetches a given table and returns an array of a single row text-indexed
		*
	 * @params 
	 * @return false|array
	 */
description:
These methods have to be implemented on the database and another class .
Most methods usable on query should be also usable directly through database, which will create the query apply its method.

description_parts.content:
These methods have to be implemented on the database and another class .
Most methods usable on query should be also usable directly through database, which will create the query apply its method.
